meanings.definition: To push or jab with a finger or a pointed object.
meanings.sent1: She was poking the dough to see if it was ready.
meanings.sent2: The child was poking the cat gently with a stick.
meanings.sent3: He kept poking his friend playfully during the movie.
meanings.sent4: The sun was poking through the clouds after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was poking the map to show us where we were.

meanings.definition: To stir or mix with a pointed object.
meanings.sent1: Mom was poking the soup to make sure it was hot.
meanings.sent2: She was poking the paint to blend the colors together.
meanings.sent3: The chef was poking the sauce with a spoon in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The wind was poking at the leaves, creating a rustling sound.
meanings.sent5: He was poking the fire to keep it burning brightly.

meanings.definition: To make a hole or indentation by pushing or jabbing.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel was poking holes in the ground to bury its nuts.
meanings.sent2: She was poking the clay to create a design on the pot.
meanings.sent3: The kids were poking their fingers into the cake before it was baked.
meanings.sent4: The flashlight was poking a beam of light through the darkness.
meanings.sent5: He was poking the straw into the juice box to drink.

meanings.sent1: The turtle was poking its head out of its shell.
meanings.sent2: The key was poking out of the lock, making it hard to turn.
meanings.sent3: The flower was poking out from behind the fence.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peak was poking through the clouds in the distance.
meanings.sent5: His toes were poking out from under the blanket while he slept.
